DOC.brief_summary: This study will determine whether application of a patch containing a topical anesthetic (numbing medicine) named lidocaine can reduce the pain of subsequent insertion of an intravenous catheter in Emergency Department patients.
DOC.brief_title: Lidocaine Patches Prior to Intravenous Insertion
DOC.detailed_description: Patients will be randomly assigned to an active lidocaine patch or a patch that conatins a placebo or inactive agent. Neither the patient nor the practitioner will know which patch is used since they will appear identical.
DOC.criteria: Age greater than or equal to 3, Need for nonemergent intravenous catheter Unstable patients, Allergy to lidocaine or tetracaine
